segment.source: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode (Windows 10)
segment.target: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode (Windows 10)

segment.source: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode
segment.target: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode

segment.source: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode
segment.target: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: After you confirm that network traffic is being correctly protected by using IPsec, you can change the rules for the domain isolation and encryption zones to require, instead of request, authentication.
segment.target: After you confirm that network traffic is being correctly protected by using IPsec, you can change the rules for the domain isolation and encryption zones to require, instead of request, authentication.

segment.source: Do not change the rules for the boundary zone; they must stay in request mode so that devices in the boundary zone can continue to accept connections from devices that are not part of the isolated domain.
segment.target: Do not change the rules for the boundary zone; they must stay in request mode so that devices in the boundary zone can continue to accept connections from devices that are not part of the isolated domain.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Convert a rule from request to require mode
segment.target: Convert a rule from request to require mode

segment.source: Apply the modified GPOs to the client devices
segment.target: Apply the modified GPOs to the client devices

segment.source: To convert a rule from request to require mode
segment.target: To convert a rule from request to require mode

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, click Connection Security Rules.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, click Connection Security Rules.

segment.source: In the details pane, double-click the connection security rule that you want to modify.
segment.target: In the details pane, double-click the connection security rule that you want to modify.

segment.source: Click the Authentication tab.
segment.target: Click the Authentication tab.

segment.source: In the Requirements section, change Authenticated mode to Require inbound and request outbound, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Requirements section, change Authenticated mode to Require inbound and request outbound, and then click OK.

segment.source: To apply the modified GPOs to the client devices
segment.target: To apply the modified GPOs to the client devices

segment.source: The next time each device refreshes its Group Policy, it will receive the updated GPO and apply the modified rule.
segment.target: The next time each device refreshes its Group Policy, it will receive the updated GPO and apply the modified rule.

segment.source: To force an immediate refresh, run the following command from an elevated command prompt:
segment.target: To force an immediate refresh, run the following command from an elevated command prompt:

segment.source: To verify that the modified GPO is correctly applied to the client devices, you can run the following command:
segment.target: To verify that the modified GPO is correctly applied to the client devices, you can run the following command:

segment.source: Examine the command output for the list of GPOs that are applied to the device, and make sure that the list contains the GPOs you expect to see on that device.
segment.target: Examine the command output for the list of GPOs that are applied to the device, and make sure that the list contains the GPOs you expect to see on that device.
